Intent: This rule ensures that the delivery location postcode is recorded in the correct format
Guidance: Check the delivery location postcode is valid on the ONS postcode checker and is recorded in the correct format
Description: The Delivery location postcode must conform to the valid postcode format
DetailedDescription:
The Delivery location postcode must conform to the valid postcode format


 (error where The first part of the 

LearningDelivery.DelLocPostCode


 <> valid format of 1 or 2 capital letters followed by (1 or 2 numbers or 1 number and a capital letter) and the second part of the 

LearningDelivery.DelLocPostCode


 <> valid format of (nXX) where n = 0-9 and XX are capital letters excluding C, I, K, M, O and V)
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by OLASS funded aims  (LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = LDM and LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode = 034)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: DelLocPostCode_03
ErrorMessage: The Delivery location postcode is not valid
Intent: This rule ensures that the delivery location postcode is a valid postcode on the lookup table
Guidance: Check the delivery location postcode is valid on the ONS postcode checker and is recorded in the correct format
Description: The Delivery location postcode should be either a valid postcode on the list of complete UK postcodes table  or ZZ99 9ZZ
DetailedDescription:
The Delivery location postcode (

LearningDelivery.DelLocPostCode


) should be either a valid postcode on the list of complete UK postcodes table (Postcodes.PostcodeValidity) or ZZ99 9ZZ

(error where

 LearningDelivery.DelLocPostCode


 <> valid lookup on Postcodes.PostcodeValidity or <> ZZ99 9ZZ)
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by OLASS funded aims  (LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = LDM and LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode = 034)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FworkCode_05
ErrorMessage: The Framework code, Pathway code and Programme type combination is not valid in the LARS database for this Learning aim reference
Intent: This rule ensures that the framework and pathway code matches the LARS database for a valid framework
Guidance: Check that the combination of framework and pathway code is valid and matches the LARS database
Description: If the learning aim is part of an apprenticeship framework, component aim then the Framework code must be a valid lookup in the Framework aims table in the LARS database for this Programme type and Pathway code
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is part of an apprenticeship framework (DD07 = Y) , component aim (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 3), then the Framework code must be a valid lookup in the Framework aims table in the LARS database for this Programme type and Pathway code

(error where is no matching record in the LARS_FrameworkAims table where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef 


= LARS_LearnAimRef and LearningDelivery.ProgType = LARS_ProgType and 

LearningDelivery.FworkCode


 = LARS_FworkCode and LearningDelivery.PwayCode = LARS_PwayCode) and there is no matching record in the LARS_FrameworkCmnComponents table where (LearningDelivery.Progtype = LARS_ProgType and LearningDelivery.FworkCode = LARS_FworkCode and 

LearningDelivery.PwayCode 


= LARS_PwayCode and LARS_FrameworkComponentType = LARS_FrameworkCommonComponent for this learning aim (where LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = LARS_LearnAimRef))
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by apprenticeship standards (LearningDelivery.ProgType = 25)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - This rule has been deleted

Name: FworkCode_02
ErrorMessage: The Framework code must not be returned
Intent: This rule ensures that the framework code is only returned for apprenticeship frameworks
Guidance: Check that the framework code has been correctly allocated and not returned on any other provision
Description: If it is a traineeship, an apprenticeship standard, a T Level Foundation Year, a skills bootcamp, a combined authority programme or the programme type is not present, the Framework code must not be returned
DetailedDescription:
If it is a traineeship, an apprenticeship standard, a T Level Foundation Year, a skills bootcamp, a combined authority programme or the programme type is not present  (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 24, 25, 30, 32, 33 or LearningDelivery.ProgType is unknown), the Framework code must not be returned

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 24, 25, 30, 32, 33 or not returned and 

LearningDelivery.FworkCode


 is known)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - This rule has been deleted

Name: FworkCode_01
ErrorMessage: The Framework code must be returned
Intent: This rule ensures that the framework code is recorded if the learner is studying an apprenticeship framework
Guidance: Check the framework code has been recorded for the applicable framework the learner is studying
Description: If the aim is a framework apprenticeship then the the Framework code must be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the aim is a framework apprenticeship (DD07 = Y), then the the Framework code must be returned

(error where

 LearningDelivery.FworkCode


 is unknown)

This rule is not triggered by apprenticeship standards (

LearningDelivery.ProgType 


= 25)
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by apprenticeship standards
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - This rule has been deleted

Name: ProgType_24
ErrorMessage: The Skills Bootcamp programme type must be returned when a Skills Bootcamp subject learning aim has been returned.
Intent: This rule ensures that skills bootcamp programme type is returned when the Skills bootcamp learning aims are used in the ILR
Guidance: Check that the programme type has been correctly added to the learners data, if the learner is not studying a skills bootcamp then an alternative learning aim must be used.
Description: If one of the Skills Bootcamp subject learning aims has been returned then the Skills Bootcamps programme type must be returned.
DetailedDescription:
If one of the Skills Bootcamp subject learning aims has been returned (LARS_CategoryRef  = 62) then the Skills Bootcamps programme type must be returned.

error where 


LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef 


= LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_CategoryRef  = 62
and


LearningDelivery.ProgType


 <> 32
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by:
Project S Pilot for Skills Bootcamps
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_23
ErrorMessage: This programme type cannot be used for this learning aim
Intent: This rule ensures that the Skills bootcamp programme type is recorded when using one of the Skills bootcamp event aims
Guidance: Ensure that the programme type has been recorded if the event aims are recorded in the ILR
Description: If one of the Skills Bootcamp subject learning aims has been returned then the Skills Bootcamps programme type must be returned.
DetailedDescription:
If one of the Skills Bootcamp subject learning aims has been returned (LARS_CategoryRef  = 62) then the Skills Bootcamps programme type must be returned.

error where 


LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef 


= LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_CategoryRef  = 62
and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType 


<> 32
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by:
Project S Pilot for Skills Bootcamps
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_22
ErrorMessage: The Source of funding is not a valid code for this programme type
Intent: This rule ensures that the combined authority programme type is only used for Devolved funded learners
Guidance: Check that the correct source of funding is used when recording the combined authority programme type
Description: If the combined authority programme type has been returned the Source of funding must be a combined authority.
DetailedDescription:
If the combined authority programme type has been returned (

LearningDelivery.ProgType 


= 33) the Source of funding must be a combined authority.

(error where

 LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 33 and DD35 = N)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_21
ErrorMessage: The Funding model is not a valid code for this Programme Type
Intent: This rule ensures that the Skills bootcamp programme type is not used on any other funding model other than 37
Guidance: Check that the Skills bootcamp funding model has been used when using the skills bootcamp programme type
Description: If the Skills Bootcamp programme type has been returned the funding model must be 37
DetailedDescription:
If the Skills Bootcamp programme type has been returned (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 32) the funding model must be 37  

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType 


= 32 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 is <> 37 )
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_20
ErrorMessage: The T Level Foundation Year programme type must be used for this learning aim reference
Intent: This rule ensures that the Tlevel foundation programme type is used for the T level learning aim reference
Guidance: Check that T level foundation year programme type has been used when the T level learning aim reference from LARS has been recorded
Description: If the learning aim is a T Level Foundation Year learning aim class code then the T Level Foundation Year programme type must be returned.
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is a T Level Foundation Year learning aim class code (ZTPRxxxx) then the T Level Foundation Year programme type must be returned.

(error where

 LearningDelivery.LearningAimRef


 = ZTPRxxxx and 

LearningDelivery. ProgType


 <> 30 or not returned)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_19
ErrorMessage: This programme type cannot be used for this learning aim
Intent: This rule ensures that the Tlevel foundation programme type is used for the T level learning aim reference
Guidance: Check that T level foundation year programme type has been used when the T level learning aim reference from LARS has been recorded
Description: If there is no record of a T Level Technical qualification in the programme, then the T level programme type must not be returned
DetailedDescription:
If there is no record of a T Level Technical qualification (LARS_

LearnAimRefType


 = 1468) in the programme, then the T level programme type must not be returned

(error where there is no record of 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 5 where LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_LearnAimRefType = 1468 and there is a record of 

LearningDelivery.ProgType 


 = 31)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_18
ErrorMessage: The T Level Foundation Year programme type must be used for this learning aim reference
Intent: This rule ensures that the Tlevel foundation programme type is used for the T level learning aim reference
Guidance: Check that T level foundation year programme type has been used when the T level learning aim reference from LARS has been recorded
Description: If the T Level Foundation Year programme type has been returned, then the T Level Foundation Year learning aim class code must be returned in the programme
DetailedDescription:
If the T Level Foundation Year programme type has been returned, then the T Level Foundation Year learning aim class code (ZTPRxxxx) must be returned in the programme

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 30  and there is no record of 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 5 where 

LearningDelivery.LearningAimRe


f = ZTPRxxxx)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_17
ErrorMessage: The T Level programme type must be used for this learning aim reference
Intent: This rule ensures that the Tlevel programme type is used for the T level learning aim reference
Guidance: Check that T level programme type has been used when the T level learning aim reference from LARS has been recorded
Description: If the learning aim is a T Level Occupational Specialism learning aim class code then the T Level programme type must be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is a T Level Occupational Specialism learning aim class code (ZTLOSxxx) then the T Level programme type must be returned

(error where

 LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef 


= ZTLOSxxx and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 <> 31 or not returned)

If the learning aim is a T Level Occupational Specialism learning aim class code then the T Level programme type must be returned
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by the Adult T level pilot
(LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = LDM and LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode = 384)
or
Non funded T Levels (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 99)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_15
ErrorMessage: The T Level programme type must be used for this work experience learning aim
Intent: This rule ensures that the T level programme type is used when using the work experience learning aim
Guidance: Ensure that the T level programme type 31 is used
Description: If the T level industry placement aim ZWRKX003 has been returned then the T level programme type must be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the T level industry placement aim (LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = ZWRKX003) has been returned then the T level programme type must be returned

(error where LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = ZWRKX003 and LearningDelivery.ProgType <> 31 or not returned)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by the Adult T level pilot
(LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = LDM and LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode = 384)
or
Non funded T Levels (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 99)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_12
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for this framework
Intent: This rule ensures that a valid learning aim is used for an Apprenticeship framework
Guidance: Check the learning aim on LARS and update accordingly
DetailedDescription:
For a funded (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 35 or 36), Early Years Educator (LearningDelivery.FworkCode = 445 and LearningDelivery.PwayCode = 1), advanced apprenticeship (LearningDelivery.ProgType = 2), component aim (LearningDelivery.AimType = 3), that started on or after 1 Sept 2014 (DD04 >= 2014-09-01), then the learning aim must be a Functional Skill, GCSE or international GCSE

(error where LARS_BasicSkillsType <> -2, -1, 11, 12, 19, 20, 33 or 34 (where LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = LARS_LearnAimRef and LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate => LARS_EffectiveFrom, and =< LARS_EffectiveTo)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered on knowledge/competency learning aims (LARS_FrameworkComponentType = 1, 2 or 3 in the LARS_FrameworkAims Table) 


Restarts (LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - This rule has been deleted

Name: ProgType_06
ErrorMessage: The Programme type is not a valid code
Intent: This rule ensures that the programme type recorded in the ILR is valid at the start of the learning aim
Guidance: Check that the programme type is valid at the start of the aim
DetailedDescription:
If the apprenticeship standard programme type (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 25) has been returned, the aim must be apprenticeship funded

(error where

 LearningDelivery.FundModel


 <> 81 or 36)
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by non funded apprenticeships (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 99).
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_02
ErrorMessage: The Programme type must not be returned for this Aim type
Intent: This rule ensures that the programme type is not returned on aimtype 4
Guidance: If the learning aim has been recorded as Aimtype 4 remove the programme type from the record to clear the error
Description: If the learning aim is not part of a programme, then the Programme type must not be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is not part of a programme (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 4), then the Programme type must not be returned


(error where

 LearningDelivery.ProgType


 is known)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_03
ErrorMessage: The Programme type is not a valid code
Intent: This rule ensures that the programme type recorded in the ILR is valid at the start of the learning aim
Guidance: Check that the programme type is valid at the start of the aim
DetailedDescription:
If returned, the Programme

 LearningDelivery.ProgType


 (is known), must be a valid lookup on the start date of the aim

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


  <> valid lookup on ILR_ProgType where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate 


> 'Valid_To' date in ILR_ProgType)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProgType_01
ErrorMessage: The Programme type must be returned for this learning aim
Intent: This rule ensures that a programme type is recorded when aimtype 1 or 3 has been returned
Guidance: Ensure that an applicable programme has been returned, for example if an Apprenticeship programme has been recorded Progtype 25 must be returned
Description: If the learning aim is part of a programme, then the Programme type must be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is part of a programme (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1 or 3), then the Programme type must be returned

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 is unknown)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: PHours_07
ErrorMessage: For Tailored learning funded aims the planned hours must be recorded which represent the timetable hours for delivery.
Intent: This rule ensures that the Phours field is recorded for Tailored learning funded learners
Guidance: Ensure that the Phours field is recorded on Tailored learning aims to indicate the duration the course is intended to take
Description: For Tailored learning, learning aims the Planned hours must be returned
DetailedDescription:
For Tailored learning, learning aims the Planned hours must be returned (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 11) 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.PHours


 is unknown)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: PHours_06
ErrorMessage: Planned hours must not be less than 278 hours
Intent: This rule ensures that the Phours field does not have a value lower than 278 recorded in accordance with the apprenticeship funding rules.
Guidance: Ensure that the value recorded in the Phours field is no less than 278
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2022, where the planned hours field has been returned, the value must not be less than 278 hours for apprenticeships.
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2022, and on or prior to 31 July 2025  where the planned hours field has been returned, the value must not be less than 278 hours for apprenticeships. 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2022-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate 


<= 2025-07-31 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 36 and if returned 

LearningDelivery.PHours


 < 278)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by Restarts (

LearningDelivery.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - Change to rule to include and on or prior to 31 July 2025

Name: PHours_05
ErrorMessage: Planned hours must not be returned for 16-19 study programmes
Intent: This rule ensures that the Phours field is not returned for learners enrolled on 16-19 study programmes
Guidance: Remove the Phours field from the learners record if they are enrolled on 16-19 funded provision
Description: Planned Hours must not be returned for 16-19 study programmes
DetailedDescription:
Planned Hours (

LearningDelivery.PHours


) must not be returned for 16-19 study programmes (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 25 and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


  <> 31 or null)


(error where 

LearningDelivery.PHours


 is not null)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: PHours_04
ErrorMessage: Planned hours must be greater than zero on the programme aim
Intent: This rule ensures that the Phours is returned with a higher value than zero
Guidance: Ensure that the Phours is returned with a higher value than zero to pass validation, this must reflect the amount of hours the programme is intended to run for.
Description: If a T Level programme has been returned, the Planned hours must be greater than zero on the programme aim
DetailedDescription:
If a T Level programme has been returned, the Planned hours must be greater than zero on the programme aim 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 25 and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 31 and 

LearningDelivery.PHours


 <= 0)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: PHours_03
ErrorMessage: Planned hours must be returned for this funding model
Intent: This rule ensures that T level programmes that start after August 2020 have the Phours field recorded
Guidance: Check the learners start date for the T level programme and then update the Phours field accordingly
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2020, programme aim Planned hours must be returned for T Level programmes
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2020, programme aims (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1) (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2020-08-01), Planned hours must be returned for T Level programmes (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 25 and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 31)


(error where 

LearningDelivery.PHours


 is unknown)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: PHours_01
ErrorMessage: Planned hours must be returned for this funding model
Intent: This rule ensures that the Phours field is returned for funding model 36 apprenticeships
Guidance: Ensure that the Phours field is returned or a funding model 36 apprenticeship, if the learner is not studying an apprenticeship ensure that the funding model is correct for the provision of study
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2019, programme aims the Planned hours must be returned for apprenticeships
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2019, programme aims (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1) (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 => 2019-08-01), Planned hours must be returned for apprenticeships (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 36) 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.PHours


 is unknown)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OTJActHours_03
ErrorMessage: Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned for withdrawn learners
Intent: This rule ensures that the off the job hours are recorded for withdrawn learners
Guidance: Check the off the job hours are recorded for the learner if they have withdrawn
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2022, where an apprenticeship has withdrawn, the Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned.
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2022, where an apprenticeship has withdrawn, the Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned. 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2022-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 36 and 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1 and 

LearningDelivery.CompStatus


 = 3 and 

LearningDelivery.OTJActHours


 is not returned)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OTJActHours_02
ErrorMessage: Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned
Intent: This rule ensures that the off the job training is returned for Apprenticeship learners
Guidance: Ensure that the off the job training hours has been recorded on an Apprenticeship programme, this rule is not triggered by restarts.
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2019, where an apprenticeship has completed, the Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned.
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2019, where an apprenticeship has completed, the Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned.
 
(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2019-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 36 and 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1 and 

LearningDelivery.CompStatus


 = 2 and 

LearningDelivery.OTJActHours


 is not returned)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by Restarts (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OTJActHours_01
ErrorMessage: Actual Hours for Off the Job Training must be returned on the programme aim
Intent: This rule ensures that the Off the Job hours is recorded on the programme only
Guidance: Check the off the job hours field has only been recorded on the programme only, remove the hours from component aims.
Description: If returned, the Actual Hours for Off the Job training must be returned on the programme aim
DetailedDescription:
If returned, the Actual Hours for Off the Job training must be returned on the programme aim


(error where there is a record of 

LearningDelivery.OTJActHours


 and 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 <> 1)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_21
ErrorMessage: This funding model is not valid for starts before 1 August 2022
Intent: This rule ensures that no ILR records are entered on a skills bootcamp before the start date of the provision
Guidance: Ensure that the learners start date is after the 1st of August 2022 if the start date is before that date then the learner is not valid for funding.
Description: If the learning aim is Skills Bootcamp funded the learning start date must be on or after 1 August 2022
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is Skills Bootcamp funded (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 37) the learning start date must be on or after 1 August 2022. 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < 01/08/2022)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_20
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date must not be before the start date of the contract
Intent: This rule ensures that there is a valid Skills bootcamp
Guidance: Check the Skills Bootcamp contract is active and valid before the learner start date, the contract must be live prior to the learner starting in the ILR.
Description: The Learning start date of the Skills Bootcamp programme aim must not be before the start date of the contract
DetailedDescription:
The Learning start date of the Skills Bootcamp programme aim (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 32 and 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1) must not be before the start date of the contract

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 32 and 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < ContractAllocation.StartDate where the 

LearningDelivery.ConRefNumber


 = ContractAllocation.ContractAllocationNumber)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_18
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date of the apprenticeship standard programme must not be after the LastDateStarts date of this apprenticeship standard
Intent: This rule ensures that the Apprenticeship Standard is still available on the learners start date and is not passed the last date for new starts for the standard.
Guidance: Check the Learners start date is recorded correctly in the ILR and check the last date for new starts on the Standard in LARS, if the standard is no longer available an alternative will need to be selected as the learner would not be able to start unless they are returning from a break in learning. If the learner is returning from a break ensure that the restart indicator is recorded on the new learning aims.
Description: For new Apprenticeship standard starts after the 1st of August 2020 the learners start date must not be after the last date for new starts for the standard in the LARS database.
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2020 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2020-08-01), if the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship standard programme (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 25), then the Learning start date of the programme (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1), must not be after the 'LastDateStarts' date for this Standard in the Standard table in LARS. 


(error where (LARS_Standard_LastDateStarts <> null and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > LARS_Standard_LastDateStarts) from the LARS_Standard table where (LARS_Standard = 

LearningDelivery.StdCode


))
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by restarts (RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_17
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date of the apprenticeship standard programme must not be before the Effective From date of this apprenticeship standard
Intent: This rule ensures that the apprenticeship standard is valid for study on the learners start date
Guidance: Check the LARS validity of the apprenticeship standard to ensure that it is valid on the learners start date and update accordingly.
Description: If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship standard programme, then the Learning start date of the programme aim must not be before the 'Effective from' date for this Standard in the Standard table in LARS
DetailedDescription:
If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship standard programme (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 25 and 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1), then the Learning start date of the programme must not be before the 'Effective from' date for this Standard in the Standard table in LARS 


(error where LARS_Standard_EffectiveFrom is known and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < LARS_Standard_EffectiveFrom) from the LARS_Standard table where (LARS_Standard = 

LearningDelivery.StdCode


)
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by restarts (RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_14
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date of the apprenticeship standard programme must not be after the Effective to date of this component aim for this standard
Intent: This rule ensures that the Apprenticeship standard component aim is valid on the learners start date
Guidance: Check the learning aims and the Apprenticeship standards validity on LARS and update accordingly ensuring that the recorded learning start date is correct.
Description: The start date of the apprenticeship component aim must not be after the effective to date of the apprenticeship standard in LARS
DetailedDescription:
If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship standard programme (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 25), then the Learning start date of the component aim (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 3), must not be after the 'Effective to' date for this Standard in the Standard table in LARS

(error where (LARS_Standard_EffectiveTo <> null and DD18 > LARS_Standard_EffectiveTo) from the LARS_Standard table where (LARS_Standard = 

LearningDelivery.StdCode


)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by restarts (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_13
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date of the apprenticeship standard programme must not be after the Effective to date of this apprenticeship standard
Intent: This rule ensures that the apprenticeship standard programme is valid in LARS on the learners start date
Guidance: Check that the learners start date is recorded correctly and check that the standard that the learner is enrolled on is valid on that date, if the start learner start date is correct then the standard is not valid for the learner to study.
Description: If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship standard programme then the Learning start date of the programme must not be after the 'Effective to' date for this Standard in the Standard table in LARS
DetailedDescription:
If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship standard programme (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 25), then the Learning start date of the programme (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1), must not be after the 'Effective to' date for this Standard in the Standard table in LARS 


(error where (LARS_Standard_EffectiveTo <> null and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > LARS_Standard_EffectiveTo) from the LARS_Standard table where (LARS_Standard = 

LearningDelivery.StdCode


))
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by Restarts (RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_12
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date must not be more than one year in the future
Intent: This rule ensures that the start date of the Apprenticeship programme is correct and valid for the current academic year.
Guidance: Check the start date recorded on the learners Apprenticeship programme and update accordingly
Description: The Apprenticeship start date cannot be 1 year after the end of the current academic year
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is part of an apprenticeship (DD07 = Y), then the Learning start date must not be more than one year after the end of the current teaching year 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > 1 year after the end of the current teaching year)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_07
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date of the apprenticeship programme must not be after the Effective to date of this component aim for this pathway
Intent: This rule ensures that the Apprenticeship Framework is valid for study on the learners start date.
Guidance: Check the Apprenticeship frame work and the learners start date to ensure that they are both recorded correctly and update accordingly.
Description: If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship framework the learning start date must not be after the "Effective to" date for the Framework on LARS.
DetailedDescription:
If the learner is undertaking an apprenticeship (DD07 = Y) framework programme (

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 3), then the Learning start date of the programme must not be after the 'Effective to' date for this framework in the Framework table in LARS 

(error where (LARS_EffectiveTo <> null AND DD04 > LARS_EffectiveTo) from the LARS_FrameworkAims table where (LARS_ProgType = 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 and LARS_FworkCode = 

LearningDelivery.FWorkCode


 and LARS_PwayCode = 

LearningDelivery.PwayCode


 and LARS_LearnAimRef = 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


)
Exclusions:
Apprenticeship standards (Progtype 25)


R

estarts (RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - This rule has been deleted

Name: LearnStartDate_02
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date is more than 10 years before the start of the current teaching year
Intent: This rule ensures that a learner cannot be returned in the ILR after 10 years
Guidance: Check that the start date recorded in the ILR is correct, where a learner historical data has been left in the ILR due to data migration issues records over 10 years must be removed.
Description: The learning start date must not be more than 10 years before the start of the current academic year
DetailedDescription:
The Learning start date must not be more than 10 years before the start of the current teaching year 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > 10 years before the start of the current teaching year)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: AimType_07
ErrorMessage: A core aim must not be recorded with a source of funding of 105
Intent: This aim ensures that the Core aim (Aim Type 5) is not recorded on learners with SOF 105
Guidance: The SOF should be recorded as 107 for learners recorded with a core aim.
Description: For new starts, learners recorded with a core aim must not be recorded with SOF 105.
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2017 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate 


=> 2017-08-01), a learning aim with a source of funding of 105 (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = SOF and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 105) cannot be recorded as a core aim. 

(error where 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 5)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: AimSeqNumber_02
ErrorMessage: The Aim sequence number is greater than the count of the learning aims
Intent: This rule ensures that the aim sequence number does not exceed the number of learning aims recorded for the learner.
Guidance: Ensure that the aim sequence number matches the number of learning aims recorded, this is usually handled by the software supplier MIS system automatically.
Description: The Aim sequence number must not be greater than the count of learning aims.
DetailedDescription:
The Aim sequence number must not be greater than the count of learning aims 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.AimSeqNumber


 > count of aims)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_21
ErrorMessage: Funding model 38 cannot be used if the Original Learning Start Date is before 1 August 2024. Use Funding model 35.
Intent: This rule ensures that the original learning start date cannot be returned on funding model 38 if the start date is before the 1st of August 2024
Guidance: Check the date which has been returned for the original learning start date, if the date is before the 1st of August 2024 the learner must be recorded as a restart under funding model 35 if they are returning to complete a course from a break in learning. If the learner is a new enrolment on funding model 38 then the original learning start date must not be returned.
Description: Adult Skills Fund funding model (Funding model 38) must not be used for aims with an Original Learning Start Date before 1 August 2024
DetailedDescription:
Adult Skills Fund funding model (Funding model 38) must not be used for aims with an Original Learning Start Date before 1 August 2024 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 38 and

 LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2024-08-01 and the 

LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate


 < 2024-08-01)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_20
ErrorMessage: This Funding model is not valid for starts before 1 August 2024
Intent: This rule ensures that a learner does not enrol onto a Tailored Learning funded learning aim prior to the 1st of August 2024
Guidance: Check the learners start date and ensure that they are enrolled on an applicable funding model
Description: Tailored Learning funding model must not be used for aims starting before 1 August 2024
DetailedDescription:
Tailored Learning funding model (Funding model 11) must not be used for aims starting before 1 August 2024 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 11 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < 2024-08-01)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_19
ErrorMessage: This Funding model is not valid for starts before 1 August 2024
Intent: This rule ensures that learners cannot enrol onto a Adult Skills Fund funded learning aim prior to the 1st of August 2024
Guidance: Check the learning start date recorded in the ILR and update accordingly
Description: Adult Skills Fund funding model (Funding model 38) must not be used for aims starting before 1 August 2024
DetailedDescription:
Adult Skills Fund funding model (Funding model 38) must not be used for aims starting before 1 August 2024 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel 


= 38 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < 2024-08-01)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_18
ErrorMessage: The funding model is not valid for this source of funding
Intent: This rule ensures that learners who start before the 1st of August 2024 do not use the funding model 38 or 11 funding models
Guidance: Check the learners start date and ensure that they are recorded on an applicable funding model in accordance with the ILR specification
Description: For starts on or after to 1 August 2024 and if a Combined Authority Source of funding has been returned then the funding model must be Adult Skills Fund or Tailored Learning
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after to 1 August 2024 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2024-08-01) and if a Combined Authority Source of funding has been returned (DD35 = Y) then the funding model must be Adult Skills Fund or Tailored Learning 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2024-08-01 and DD35 = Y and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 <> 38 or 11)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by Restarts (

LearningDelivery.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_17
ErrorMessage: This funding model is not valid for the start date of the learning aim
Intent: This rule ensures that learners cannot be enrolled on funding model 35 after the 1st of August 2024 unless they are restarting an aim which they have previously started.
Guidance: Check that the learner has been recorded with the correct funding model for their start date, if this learner has previously started a learning aim under funding model 35 and went on a break in learning then they can return to that aim but the restart indicator must be returned.
DetailedDescription:
If the Adult Skills Funding model has been returned (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35), the learning start date of the aim must not be on or after 1 August 2024. 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2024-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by Restarts (

LearningDelivery.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_16
ErrorMessage: This funding model is not valid for this programme type
Intent: This rule ensure that both the Skills bootcamp funding model and programme type has been returned for Skills bootcamp learners
Guidance: Check both the funding model 37 and programme type 32 has been recorded on the Skills bootcamp learning aims.
Description: If funding model 37 has been returned, the  programme type must be Skills Bootcamps
DetailedDescription:
If funding model 37 (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 37) has been returned, the  programme type must be Skills Bootcamps (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 32).

(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 37 and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 <> 32)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_15
ErrorMessage: This funding model is not valid for this LDM code
Intent: This rule ensures that LDM code 378 is only recorded on Adult education budget or adult skills fund funded aims
Guidance: Check that the funding model is recorded correctly, if it is not funding model 35 or 38, then the LDM code must not be used on that learning aim.
Description: If the 'Level 3 Free Courses for Jobs' learning delivery monitoring code has been returned, then the aim must be adult skills or Adult Skills Fund funded
DetailedDescription:
If the 'Level 3 Free Courses for Jobs' learning delivery monitoring code has been returned, then the aim must be adult skills or Adult Skills Fund funded 


(error where 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 378 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel




l 


<> 35  or 38)  )
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_14
ErrorMessage: This funding model is not valid when returning this field
Intent: This rule ensures that the off The jobs hours field is only recorded for Apprenticeship learners
Guidance: ensure that if the off the job actual hours are recorded that the learner is enrolled on an Apprenticeship under funding model 36, if the learner is not on an apprenticeship the OTJ hours must be removed
Description: If the Actual Hours for Off the Job Training field has been returned, then the funding model must be Apprenticeships
DetailedDescription:
If the Actual Hours for Off the Job Training field has been returned, then the funding model must be Apprenticeships 

(error where there is a record of 

LearningDelivery.OTJActHours


 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


l <> 36)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_07
ErrorMessage: The funding model is not valid for an apprenticeship programme
Intent: This rule ensures that any apprenticeship starts which enrol after the 1st of May 2017 is recorded as funding model 36
Guidance: Check the learners start date recorded in the ILR for Apprenticeships, if this date is after the 1st of May 2017 then funding model 36 must be recorded
Description:
Funded apprenticeship programmes that 

started on or after 1 May 2017, must be Funding model 36
DetailedDescription:
Funded apprenticeship (DD07 = Y), programmes (

LearningDelivery.AimType 


= 1), that started on or after 1 May 2017 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2017-05-01), must be Funding model 36


(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel 


<> 36)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by non-funded apprenticeships (DD07 = Y and LearningDelivery.FundModel = 99)


Aims that are a restart (LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = RES), 


LDM LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode = 353, 355)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_06
ErrorMessage: The funding model is not valid for this aim
Intent: This rule ensures that funding model 36 is only used on Apprenticeship aims
Guidance: Ensure that funding model 36 is only used on Apprenticeship aims and ZProg001 is used on aimtype 1
Description: If the learning aim is apprenticeship funded, then it must be an apprenticeship aim
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is apprenticeship funded (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 36), then it must be an apprenticeship aim

(error where DD07 = N)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_03
ErrorMessage: The Funding model is not valid for a learning aim financed by an Advanced Learner Loan
Intent: This rule ensures that Advanced learner loans funded learners are recorded as funding model 99
Guidance: Check which funding model has been recorded, if the learner has the ADL indicator for advanced learner loans the funding model must be recorded as 99
Description: The Funding model must be 'Non-funded', if the learning aim is financed by an Advanced Learner Loan
DetailedDescription:
The Funding model must be 'Non-funded', if the learning aim is financed by an Advanced Learner Loan (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = ADL) 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 <> 99)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: FundModel_01
ErrorMessage: The Funding model is not a valid code
Intent: This rule ensures that the funding model recorded in the ILR is a valid code in the ILR specification for the academic year of study.
Guidance: Check the funding model recorded in the ILR is valid in the ILR specification for the academic year the learner has enrolled in and update accordingly. If the learner started after the 1st of August then this learner must not have the new aims recorded in the previous years R14 return.
Description: The Funding model must be a valid lookup
DetailedDescription:
The Funding model (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


) must be a valid lookup 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 <> valid lookup on ILR_FundModel)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_108
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model and this Learning start date
Intent: To ensure that Community learning aims are returned for the correct valid dates in the LARS service
Guidance: Ensure that, for learning aim starts on or after 1 August 2021 that are Community Learning funded and are not Restarts, the learning aim start date must not be before the validity start date or be after the last date for new starts for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database, shown through the FALA service
Description: For new starts on or after 1 August 2021 and are Community Learning funded then the learning aim start date must not be before the validity start date or be after the last date for new starts (unless the restart indicator is present) for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database
DetailedDescription:
For new starts on or after 1 August 2021 and are Community Learning funded then the learning aim start date must not be before the validity start date or be after the last date for new starts (unless the restart indicator is present) for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database. 

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >= 2021-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 10 and (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < LARS_StartDate in the LARS Validity table or (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > LARS_LastNewStartDate in the LARS_Validity table and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFamType


 = RES does not exist)) where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = COMM_LEARN))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_107
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model for this teaching year
Intent: To ensure that Community learning aims are returned for the correct valid dates in the LARS service
Guidance: Ensure that, for learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 that are Community Learning funded, the learning Actual end date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database, shown through the FALA service
Description: For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are Community Learning funded, then the learning Actual end date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database
DetailedDescription:
For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are Community Learning funded then the Learning Actual End Date of the aim must be before the validity end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database. 

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >= 2020-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 10 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >  LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = COMM_LEARN))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_106
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model and this Learning start date
Intent: To ensure that Community learning aims are returned for the correct valid dates in the LARS service
Guidance: Ensure that, for learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 that are Community Learning funded, the Learning start date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database, shown through the FALA service
Description: For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are Community Learning funded, then the Learning start date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database
DetailedDescription:
For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are Community Learning funded, then the Learning start date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database.

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >= 2020-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 10 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < LARS_StartDate or >  LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = COMM_LEARN))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_88
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model and this Learning start date
Intent: To ensure that for starts before 1 August 2021, the learning aim validity criteria matches the code in Table 1 of the LARS validity codes, or through the LARS category code where applicable
Guidance: Ensure that, for starts before 1 August 2021, the learning aim validity criteria in FALA must be met in Table 1 of the LARS validity codes, or through the LARS category code where applicable
Description: For starts before 1 August 2021 the learning aim validity criteria must be met in Table 1 of the LARS validity codes, the learning aim start date must be valid in LARS by looking at the funding validity for the corresponding Validity category or by looking at the category code where applicable
DetailedDescription:
For starts before 1 August 2021 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < 2021-08-01) the learning aim validity criteria must be met in Table 1, the learning aim start date must be valid in LARS by looking at the funding validity (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < LARS_StartDate or >  LARS_LastNewStartDate in the LARS_Validity table) for the corresponding Validity category where 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef or by looking at the category code where applicable (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 < LARS_EffectiveFrom or >  LARS_EffectiveTo in the LARS_LearningDeliveryCategory) for the corresponding LARS_CategoryRef where 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_56
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for Adult skills funding
Intent: To ensure that OLASS or RoTL learners are not funded through Adult skills funding for Security License to Practise learning aims that started after 1 August 2015
Guidance: Ensure that for aims funded by the ESFA adult skills funding methodology, where the learner is either OLASS or RoTL, they are not funded through Adult skills funding for Security License to Practise learning aims
Description: If the learning aim started on or after 1 August 2015 and the aim is funded by the ESFA adult skills funding methodology and the learner is either OLASS or RoTL, then they cannot be funded through the Adult skills funding model for Security License to Practise learning aims
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim started on or after 1 August 2015 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 => 2015-08-01) and the aim is funded by the ESFA adult skills funding methodology (

LearningDelivery.FundModel 


= 35, 81) and the learner is either OLASS or RoTL, (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType 


= LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 034 or 328) then they cannot be funded through the Adult skills funding model for Security License to Practise learning aims (LARS_LearningDeliveryCategory.CategoryRef = 22 (where 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_111
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model for this teaching year
Intent: To ensure that Loans funded learning aims are returned for the correct valid dates in the LARS service
Guidance: Ensure that, for learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020, that are financed by an Advanced Learner Loan, the Learning Actual End Date of the aim must be before the validity end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database, shown through the FALA service
Description: For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are financed by an Advanced Learner Loan, then the Learning Actual End Date of the aim must be before the validity end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database
DetailedDescription:
For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are financed by an Advanced Learner Loan, then the Learning Actual End Date of the aim must be before the validity end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database. 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >= 2020-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


  = 99 and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = ADL and 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >  LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = ADV_LEARN_LOAN))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_112
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model and this Learning start date
Intent: To ensure that learning aims are returned for the correct valid dates in the LARS service for Advanced learner loans
Guidance: Ensure that, for new starts on or after 1 August 2021,  financed by an Advanced Learner Loan and are not restarts, the learning aim start date must not be before the validity start date or after the last date for new starts for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database, shown through the FALA service
Description: For new starts on or after 1 August 2021 and are financed by an Advanced Learner Loan, then the learning aim start date must not be before the validity start date or be after the last date for new starts (unless the restart indicator is present) for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database
DetailedDescription:
For new starts on or after 1 August 2021 and are financed by an Advanced Learner Loan, then the learning aim start date must not be before the validity start date or be after the last date for new starts (unless the restart indicator is present) for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database.

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2021-08-01 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 99 and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = ADL and (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


  < LARS_StartDate in the LARS Validity table or  (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


  > LARS_LastNewStartDate in the LARS_Validity table and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES does not exist)) where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


= LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = ADV_LEARN_LOAN))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_114
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model and this Learning start date
Intent: To ensure that learning aims are returned for the correct valid dates in the LARS service
Guidance: Ensure that, for aims that are part of a funded apprentice standard programme, a Skills Bootcamp, Other Adult or Non funded component aims, the Learning start date of the aim is between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database, shown through the FALA service
Description: For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are part of a funded apprentice standard programme, a Skills Bootcamp, Other Adult or Non funded component aims, then the Learning start date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database
DetailedDescription:
For learning aims ending on or after 1 August 2020 and are part of a funded apprentice standard programme, a Skills Bootcamp, Other Adult or Non funded component aims, then the Learning start date of the aim must be between the validity start date and end date for the corresponding validity category in the Validity table in the LARS database.

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnActEndDate


 >= 2020-08-01 and ((

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 36 and 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 25) or (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 37) or (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 81) or (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 99)) and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate 


< LARS_StartDate or > LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = ANY))
Exclusions:
This rule excludes: Advanced Learner Loans (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType 


= ADL)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

DetailedDescription:

(error where

Name: LSDPostcode_01
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date postcode is not valid
Intent: To ensure that only valid postcodes are used for adult skills or Community Learning funded aims
Guidance: Ensure that, for starts on or after 1 August 2019 and before 1 August 2024, that are adult skills or Community Learning funded, the Learning start date postcode is returned, and that it is a valid postcode on the AEB/ASF table of UK postcodes
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2019 and on or prior to 31 July 2024, that are adult skills or Community Learning funded, the Learning start date postcode must be returned and be a valid postcode on the list of complete UK postcodes table
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2019 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


  => 2019-08-01) and on or prior to 31 July 2024 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


  <= 2024-07-31), are adult skills or Community Learning funded (

LearningDelivery.Fundmodel


= 35 or 

LearningDelivery.Fundmodel


 = 10), the Learning start date postcode (

LearningDelivery.LSDPostcode


) must be returned and be a valid postcode on the list of complete UK postcodes table

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LSDPostcode


<> (a valid lookup on Postcodes.PostcodeValidity)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered where 

LearningDelivery.LSDPostcode


 = ZZ99 9ZZ or aims that are part of a traineeship (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 24) or apprenticeship frameworks (DD07 = Y) or are  programme component aims (

LearningDelivery.Aimtype


 = 3)

Name: LearnPlanEndDate_03
ErrorMessage: The Learning planned end date must not be 10 years or more after the Learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the planned end date recorded in the ILR is not more than 10 years after the recorded learner start date
Guidance: Check the date recorded in the planned end date field and update accordingly, if the learners start date has been recorded incorrectly this must be changed first.
Description: The Learning planned end date, must be less than 10 years after the Learning start date
DetailedDescription:
The Learning planned end date (

LearningDelivery.LearnPlanEndDate


), must be less than 10 years after the Learning start date (LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate) 


(error where LearningDelivery.LearnPlanEndDate - 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 => 10 years)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnPlanEndDate_02
ErrorMessage: The Learning planned end date must not be before the Learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the planned end date is not before the Learning start date
Guidance: Check the planned end date in the ILR and update accordingly, this must on or after the learning start date.
Description: The Learning planned end date, must not be before the Learning aim start date
DetailedDescription:
The Learning planned end date 

(LearningDelivery.LearnPlanEndDate


), must not be before the Learning aim start date (LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate) 


(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearnPlanEndDate


 < 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: AimType_08
ErrorMessage: The Aim type must be the Core aim
Intent: This rule ensures that the ZTPRxxxx learning aim for T level foundation years is recorded as the Core aim (AimType 5).
Guidance: To clear this error the ZTPRxxxx aim needs to be recorded as AimType 5, this error will not be corrected if the aimtype remains 3, 4 or 1.
Description: A T Level Foundation Year class code ZTPRxxxx must be recorded as aimtype 5 if it is present in the data.
DetailedDescription:
If a T Level Foundation Year learning aim class code (ZTPRxxxx) has been returned, then it must be the Core aim.

(error where 

LearningDelivery.LearningAimRef


 = ZTPRxxxx and the 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 <> 5)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_10
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model on this Original learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the learning aim is valid in LARS on the original learner start date for Skills bootcamps
Guidance: Check the learning aim on the LARS data base ensuring that it is valid for Skills Bootcamps and update accordingly
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned, and the aim is Skills Bootcamp funded, then the Original learning start date must be between the validity start date and end date in the LARS database for this learning aim
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), and the aim is Skills Bootcamp funded (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 37), then the Original learning start date must be between the validity start date and end date in the LARS database for this learning aim



(error where there is no record where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is between LARS_StartDate and LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = ANY)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_09

Intent: This rule ensures that the original learner start date is not used for funding model 36 Apprenticeships before the 1st of May 2017 to ensure it is not used before the start of the provision.
Guidance: Check the original learning start date is not recorded before the 1st of May 2017 and update accordingly
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned ), and the aim is part of an apprenticeship that started on or after 1 May 2017 then the original learning start date cannot be before 1 May 2017
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), and the aim is part of an apprenticeship that started on or after 1 May 2017 (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 36), then the original learning start date cannot be before 1 May 2017


(error where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate < 2017-05-01)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year
