 < LARS_StartDate or >  LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = ADULT_SKLLS))
Exclusions:
This rule excludes: Apprenticeship provision (DD07 = Y), OLASS learners (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


  = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 034), Combined authorities (DD35 = Y),  or Level 3 Free Courses for Jobs (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 378)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_90
ErrorMessage: This work experience aim must not be returned for this programme type
Intent: To ensure that Traineeship work experience, Supported Internship or CDF Industry placement learning aims are not also returned on the same T level programme
Guidance: Ensure that, where a T level programme has been returned, a Traineeship work experience aim, a Supported Internship or a CDF Industry placement learning aim has not been returned in the same T level programme
Description: If a T Level programme has been returned, then a Traineeship work experience aim, a Supported Internship or a CDF Industry placement learning aim must not be returned in that programme
DetailedDescription:
If a T Level programme has been returned, then a Traineeship work experience aim, a Supported Internship or a CDF Industry placement learning aim must not be returned in that programme

(error where 

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 31 and 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = Z0007834, Z0007835, Z0007836, Z0007837, Z0007838, Z0002347, ZWRKX001 or ZWRKX002)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_85
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for Adult skills funding
Intent: To ensure that level 3 aims are only funded for those learners who do not already have a level 3 or above prior  attainment, except where excluded
Guidance: Ensure that for level 3 aim starts on or after 1 August 2017 and on or prior to 31 July 2024, funded through Adult skills, that the learner's prior attainment is not level 3 or above
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2017 and on or prior to 31 July 2024 and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model and the learner's prior attainment is level 3 or above, then the aim must not be a level 3 aim
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2017 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 => 2017-08-01) and on or prior to 31 July 2024 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 <= 2024-07-31) and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35), and the learner's prior attainment is level 3 or above (

PriorAttain.PriorLevel


 = (6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 97 or 98), then the aim must not be a level 3 aim 

(error where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef) and LARS_NotionalNVQLevelv2 = 3)


The 

PriorAttain


 used will be the latest where the 

DateLevelApp


<=

LearnStartDate
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by apprenticeships (DD07 = Y) or Restarts (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES) or Full funding for learners in devolved areas (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = DAM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 023) or Traineeships (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 24) or Level 3 Free Courses for Jobs (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 378) and Learner is unemployed with benefits (DD38 = Y) or (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 382)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_84
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for Adult skills funding
Intent: To ensure that level 3 aims are funded through the correct Adult education budget route
Guidance: Ensure that for level 3 aim starts on or after 1 August 2017 and on or prior to 31 July 2024, funded through Adult skills, that there is an entitlement LARS category code in FALA
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2017 and on or prior to 31 July 2024 and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model, and is a level 3 aim, the aim must have an entitlement LARS category code
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2017 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 => 2017-08-01) and on or prior to 31 July 2024 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 <= 2024-07-31) and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35), and is a level 3 aim (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_NotionalNVQLevelv2 = 3), the aim must have an entitlement LARS category code

(error where LARS_CategoryRef  <> 38 or LARS_CategoryRef  = 38 (where 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 <  LARS_EffectiveFrom or 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > LARS_EffectiveTo in LARS_LearningDeliveryCategory)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by apprenticeships (DD07 = Y), OLASS learners (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 034), or Restarts (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES) or Full funding for learners in devolved areas (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = DAM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 023) or Traineeships (

LearningDelivery.ProgType


 = 24) or Level 3 Free Courses for Jobs (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 378)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_81
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for Adult skills funding
Intent: To ensure that learners funded through the Adult skills and claiming other state benefits, are not enrolled on a License to Practise aim
Guidance: Ensure that for starts on or after 1 August 2016, where the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills and the learner is claiming other state benefits, that the aim is not a License to Practise
Description: For starts on or after 1 August 2016 and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model, and the learner is claiming other state benefits, then they cannot be funded for License to Practise learning aims
DetailedDescription:
For starts on or after 1 August 2016 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 => 2016-08-01)  and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35, 81), and the learner is claiming other state benefits (

EmploymentStatusMonitoring.ESMType


 = BSI and 

EmploymentStatusMonitoring.ESMCode


 = 3) on 

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


), then they cannot be funded for License to Practise learning aims

(error where  (LARS_LearningDeliveryCategory.CategoryRef=20 and all child records of category 20 where 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef))
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_79
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for Adult skills funding
Intent: To ensure that level 4 aims are not funded through the Adult education budget funding model
Guidance: Ensure that for aim starts after 31 July 2016 and on or prior to 31 July 2024, where the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model, the aim is not a level 4 aim
Description: For starts after 31 July 2016 and on or prior to 31 July 2024, where the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model, then the aim must not be a level 4 aim
DetailedDescription:
For starts after 31 July 2016 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 > 2016-07-31), and on or prior to 31 July 2024 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 <= 2024-07-31) and the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35), then the aim must not be a level 4 aim

(error where (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef) and LARS_NotionalNVQLevelv2 = 4)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by apprenticeships (DD07 = Y), OLASS learners (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 034), or Restarts (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES), or Full funding for learners in devolved areas (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


  = DAM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 023)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_78
ErrorMessage: The learning aim is not valid for Adult skills funding
Intent: To ensure that level 3 aims funded through the Adult skills funding model have the correct entitlement LARS category code attached to the aim in FALA
Guidance: Ensure that for aim starts between 1 August 2016 and 31 July 2017 (that are not Apprenticeship, Restart, Steel Industries Redundancy Training or delivered by a provider with an organisation type of Specialist Designated College), and the aim is level 3 and funded through the Adult skills funding model, there must be an entitlement LARS category code attached to the aim in FALA
Description: For starts between 1 August 2016 and 31 July 2017,  if the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model, and is level 3, then the aim must have an entitlement LARS category code
DetailedDescription:
For starts between 1 August 2016  (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2016-08-01) and 31 July 2017 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 <= 2017-07-31),  if the learning aim is funded through the Adult skills funding model (

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 = 35), and is level 3 (

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_NotionalNVQLevelv2 = 3), then the aim must have an entitlement LARS category code

(error where LARS_CategoryRef  <> 38)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by apprenticeships (DD07 = Y), OLASS learners (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 034), or Restarts (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = RES) or Steel Industries Redundancy Training (

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType


 = LDM and 

LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode


 = 347), or Providers with an organisation type of Specialist Designated College (

LearningProvider.UKPRN


 = Org_Details.UKPRN and LegalOrgType = USDC)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_30
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid for a programme aim
Intent: To ensure that the ZPROG001 is only used for Programme aims
Guidance: Ensure that aim reference ZPROG001 is only used where the Aimtype = 1 (Programme aim)
Description: Learning aim reference ZPROG001 is only valid on aims where the Aimtype = 1. Any other combination of these two values is invalid
DetailedDescription:
The learning aim 

LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef


 = ZPROG001 is only valid on aims where the 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 1. Any other combination of these two values is invalid
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnAimRef_01
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not a valid lookup on LARS
Intent: To ensure that learning aim references returned are valid lookups on the LARS database
Guidance: Ensure that the learning aim reference is a valid lookup on the LARS database and is available through the Find a Learning aim (FALA) service
Description: The Learning aim reference must be a valid lookup on the LARS database
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_05
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is not valid in the LARS database for this Funding model on this Original learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the learning aim recorded with the original learning start date is valid in LARS
Guidance: Check the LARS database to ensure that the learning aim you have recorded is valid for apprenticeship funding on the original learning start date, if this aim is not available for that funding model then it must not be used.
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned and the aim is a component aim and the learning aim is part of a funded apprenticeship framework programme, then the Original learning start date must be between the validity start date and end date in the LARS database for this learning aim.
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), and the aim is a component aim (LearningDelivery.AimType = 3) and the learning aim is part of a funded apprenticeship framework programme (DD07 = Y), then the Original learning start date must be between the validity start date and end date in the LARS database for this learning aim

(error where there is no record where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is between LARS_StartDate and LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = APPRENTICESHIPS)
Exclusions: This rule is not triggered by apprenticeship standards (ProgType = 25)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - This rule has been deleted

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_04
ErrorMessage: The Restart indicator has not been returned
Intent: This rule ensures that the restart indicator is returned when the original learning start date is recorded
Guidance: Add the restart indicator if the learner has a valid learning start date recorded in the ILR
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned then there must be a Restart indicator
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), then there must be a Restart indicator


(error where there is no record of LearningDeliveryFAMType.FAMType = RES)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_03
ErrorMessage: The Original learning start date must not be returned
Intent: This rule ensures that the original learning start date is only recorded for applicable programmes
Guidance: Check the original learning start date is not recorded on 16-19 and Community learning aims as it is not applicable, if the dates are returned, remove them to clear the error.
Description: If the learning aim is funded by 16-19 non-apprenticeship or community learning provision  then the Original learning start date must not be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the learning aim is funded by 16-19 non-apprenticeship or community learning provision (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 25, 82 or 10), then the Original learning start date must not be returned


(error where LearningDelivery.FundModel = 25, 82 or 10 and LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_02
ErrorMessage: The Original learning start date must not be on or after the Learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the original learning start date is before the recorded start date of the learning aim in the ILR.
Guidance: Check the learning start date and the original start date is correct in the ILR and adjust accordingly.
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned then it must be before the Learning start date
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), then it must be before the Learning start date


 (error where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate >= LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_01
ErrorMessage: The Original learning start date must not be more than 10 years before the Learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the original learning start date is not 10 years before the learning start date to assist with Data quality.
Guidance: Check the date recorded for the original learning start date is correct.
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned then it must not be more than 10 years before the Learning start date
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), then it must not be more than 10 years before the Learning start date 


(error where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate > 10 years before LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_05
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date must not be on or before the learner's Date of birth
Intent: This rule ensures that the learners start date is valid.
Guidance: Check the learners start date and date of birth that has been entered into the ILR and update accordingly
Description: The Learning start date must be after the learner's Date of birth.
DetailedDescription:
The Learning start date must be after the learner's Date of birth. 
(error where Learner.DateOfBirth is known and >= LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnStartDate_03
ErrorMessage: The Learning start date must not be after the end of the current teaching year
Intent: This rule ensures that the start date of a learning aim does not occur after the end of the academic year
Guidance: Check and amend the start date to the correct date, if this learning aim falls into the next academic year during the duel return window, remove it from the previous year and submit for R01 of the next academic year.
Description: The Learning start date must not be after the current teaching year
DetailedDescription:
The Learning start date must not be after the current teaching year

(error where LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate > the end of the current teaching year)
Exclusions:
Apprenticeships (Funding model 36)


Skills Bootcamps (Funding model 37)


T level Programmes (Progtype 31)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: OrigLearnStartDate_11
ErrorMessage: The Learning aim reference is Adult skills funded and is not valid in the LARS database on this Original learning start date
Intent: This rule ensures that the learning aim recorded is valid on the original learning start date for Adult Skills fund funded learners
Guidance:
Ch

eck the LARS database to ensure that the learning aim is valid for adult Skills fund learners on the original learning start date recorded in the ILR.
Description: If the Original learning start date is returned), and the aim is Adult Skills Fund funded , then the Original learning start date must be between the validity start date and end date in the LARS database for this learning aim
DetailedDescription:
If the Original learning start date is returned (LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is known), and the aim is Adult Skills Fund funded (LearningDelivery.FundModel = 38), then the Original learning start date must be between the validity start date and end date in the LARS database for this learning aim

(error where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is returned 
and LearningDelivery.FundModel = 38
and there is no record where LearningDelivery.OrigLearnStartDate is between LARS_StartDate and LARS_EndDate in the LARS_Validity table where (LearningDelivery.LearnAimRef = LARS_LearnAimRef and LARS_ValidityCategory = ADULT_SKILLS)
Exclusions:
This rule is not triggered by:
Level 3 Free Courses for Jobs (LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMType = LDM and LearningDeliveryFAM.LearnDelFAMCode = 378)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: AimType_05
ErrorMessage: The Aim type is not valid for this Funding model
Intent: This rule ensures that the core aim is only recorded for 16-19 funded provision.
Guidance: This rule will only trigger where the core aim (AimType 5) is recorded on a provision which is not 16-19 funded (funding model 25) to clear this error remove the Aim or change the funding model to 25.
Description: The core aim is only valid for 16-19 provision and should not be recorded on any other funding model
DetailedDescription:
The 'Core aim' is only valid for 16-19 non apprenticeship provision (error where 

LearningDelivery.AimType


 = 5 and 

LearningDelivery.FundModel


 <> 25 or 82)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: DateOfBirth_24
ErrorMessage: The Unique learner number has been returned and the Date of birth has not been returned
Intent: To ensure that a Date of birth is returned for all records with a ULN
Guidance: Ensure that, where a learner ULN is known and is not the default value (9999999999), then the Date of birth is also returned
Description: If the Unique learner number is known and is not the default value (9999999999), then the Date of birth must be returned
DetailedDescription:
If the Unique learner number is known and is not the default value (

Learner.ULN


 <> 9999999999), then the Date of birth must be returned

(error where 

Learner.DateOfBirth


 is not known)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: AimType_01
ErrorMessage: The Aim type is not a valid code
Intent: This rule ensures that the Aim type is valid in the ILR specification
Guidance: Record the aim type in accordance with the ILR specification
Description: The Aim type must be a valid lookup in the ILR reference data
DetailedDescription:
The Aim type must be a valid lookup (error where 

LearningDelivery.AimType 


<> valid lookup on ILR_AimType)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: ProvSpecLearnMonOccur_01
ErrorMessage: The Provider specified learner monitoring occurrence is not 'A' or 'B'
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, the Provider specified learner monitoring occurrence is only returned in field 'A' or 'B'
Guidance: Ensure that, if Provider specified learner monitoring is returned, the occurrence is in field 'A' or 'B' only
Description: If Provider specified learner monitoring is returned, the occurrence must be field 'A' or 'B' only
DetailedDescription:
If Provider specified learner monitoring is returned (

ProviderSpecLearnerMonitoring.ProvSpecLearnMonOccur


 is known), occurrence must be 'A' or 'B'

(error where 

ProviderSpecLearnerMonitoring.ProvSpecLearnMonOccur


 <> 'A' or 'B')
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_17
ErrorMessage: NLM22 and NLM21 cannot be recorded for the same learner
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, NLM22 and NLM21 are not utilised in the same learner record
Guidance: Ensure that, if FAM Type of Special Educational Needs (SEN) is recorded, the learner does not a record of FAM type EHC as well
Description: Where the Learner Funding and Monitoring type NLM 21 (Learner repeating up to one full final year of 16-19 funded provision) is returned, then NLM 22 (Learner in receipt of 16-19 tuition fund) must not be returned for the same learner
DetailedDescription:
Where the Learner Funding and Monitoring type  of National learner monitoring (NLM) and Learner repeating up to one full final year of 16-19 funded provision (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = NLM and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


  = 22) then Learner in receipt of 16-19 tuition fund (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = NLM and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


  = 21) must not be returned for the same learner 

(error where there is a record of 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = NLM and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 = 22 and there is a record of 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = NLM and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 = 21 for the same learner)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_16
ErrorMessage: The learner is recorded as exempt from English GCSE condition of funding due to a learning difficulty but there is no Education health care plan recorded
Intent: To ensure that an Education health care plan is recorded in the correct situation
Guidance: Ensure that, where returned, if the learner is recorded as exempt from English GCSE condition of funding due to a learning difficulty, an Education health care plan is recorded
Description: If the learner is exempt from English GCSE condition of funding due to learning difficulties or disabilities, they must have an Education health care plan (EHC plan)
DetailedDescription:
If the learner is exempt from English GCSE condition of funding due to learning difficulties or disabilities (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = ECF and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 = 1), they must have an Special Educational Needs (SEN) or Education health care plan (EHC plan)


(error where 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 <> EHC)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_15
ErrorMessage: The learner is recorded as exempt from maths GCSE condition of funding due to a learning difficulty but there is no Education health care plan recorded
Intent: To ensure that an Education health care plan is recorded in the correct situation
Guidance: Ensure that, where returned, if the learner is recorded as exempt from maths GCSE condition of funding due to a learning difficulty, an Education health care plan is recorded
Description: If the learner is exempt from maths GCSE condition of funding due to learning difficulties or disabilities, they must have an Education health care plan (EHC plan)
DetailedDescription:
If the learner is exempt from maths GCSE condition of funding due to learning difficulties or disabilities (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = MCF and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 = 1), they must have an Education health care plan (EHC plan)

(error where 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 <> EHC)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_14
ErrorMessage: The learner must not have both a FAM type of SEN and EHC
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, FAM Type of Special Educational Needs (SEN) and EHC are not used in the same learner record
Guidance: Ensure that, if FAM Type of Special Educational Needs (SEN) is recorded, the learner does not a record of FAM type EHC as well
Description: If a Learner FAM Type of Special Educational Needs (SEN) is recorded, the learner must not have a record of FAM type EHC as well
DetailedDescription:
If a Learner FAM Type of Special Educational Needs (SEN) is recorded (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = SEN and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 = 1), the learner must not have a record of FAM type EHC as well

(error where there is also a record of (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = EHC and 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 = 1)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_11
ErrorMessage: There must not be more than two records with a FAM type of EDF or NLM
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, FAM type NLM or EDF is not used more than twice per learner
Guidance: Ensure that, where returned, FAM type NLM or EDF is not used more than twice per learner
Description: If the FAM type is NLM or EDF there must be no more than two occurrences
DetailedDescription:
If the FAM type is NLM or EDF there must be no more than two occurrences

(error where 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 = NLM or EDF and occurrences > 2)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_10
ErrorMessage: There must not be more than four records with a FAM type of LSR
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, FAM type LSR is not used more than four times per learner
Guidance: Ensure that, where returned, FAM type LSR is not used more than four times per learner
Description: If the FAM type is LSR there must be no more than four occurrences
DetailedDescription:
If the FAM type is LSR there must be no more than four occurrences

(error where 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 =  LSR and occurrences > 4)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_03
ErrorMessage: The FAM type and code is not valid for this Learning start date
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, the FAMType and FAMCode are valid
Guidance: Where a FAM type and code is returned in the learner record, it must be dated before the 'valid to' date for the type and code
Description: The earliest Learning start date must not be after the 'Valid to' date for this FAMType and FAMCode
DetailedDescription:
The earliest Learning start date must not be after the 'Valid to' date for this FAMType and FAMCode

(error where DD06 > 'Valid to' in ILR_FAMTypeCode)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: LearnFAMType_01
ErrorMessage: The FAM type and code is not valid
Intent: To ensure that, where returned, the FAM type and code is valid
Guidance: Where a FAM type and code is returned in the learner record, it must be valid
Description: If a FAM type is returned, the FAM code must be a valid lookup for that FAM type
DetailedDescription:
If a FAM type is returned (

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMType


 is known), the FAM code must be a valid lookup for that FAM type

(error where 

LearnerFAM.LearnFAMCode


 <> valid lookup on ILR_FAMTypeFAMCode)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

Name: PrimaryLLDD_04
ErrorMessage: The Primary LLDD and health problem is not recorded
Intent: To ensure that if there is only one LLDD and health problem in the learner record, there is also a Primary LLDD and health problem returned
Guidance: Ensure that, where there is only one LLDD and Health problem record returned, that there is also a Primary LLDD and health problem recorded
Description: If there is only one LLDD and Health problem record returned then the Primary LLDD and health problem must be recorded
DetailedDescription:
If there is only one LLDD and Health problem record (there is one occurrence of 

LLDDandHealthProblem


 record) then the Primary LLDD and health problem must be recorded

(error where  

LLDDandHealthProblem.PrimaryLLDD


 is unknown)

Name: NINumber_01
ErrorMessage: The National Insurance number is not in the correct format
Intent: This rule ensures that the National insurance number recorded in the ILR is in the correct format.
Guidance:
Check the value recorded in the National insurance number field to ensure that it is recorded in the correct format in accordance with the ILR specification. (e first character must not be D, F, I, Q, U or V and the second character must not be D, F, I, O, Q, U or V and characters 3 to 8 must be numeric and character 9 must be A, B, C, D or space)


If the formatting is incorrect update the value and resubmit the data.
Description:
If the National insurance number has been recorded in the ILR it must be recorded in the following format the first character must not be D, F, I, Q, U or V and the second character must not be D, F, I, O, Q, U or V and characters 3 to 8 must be numeric and character 9 must be A, B, C, D or space. 


 The validation rule will trigger if the number recorded in the ILR is not in the above format.
DetailedDescription:
If the NI Number is returned (

Learner.NINumber 


is known), the first character must not be D, F, I, Q, U or V and the second character must not be D, F, I, O, Q, U or V and characters 3 to 8 must be numeric and character 9 must be A, B, C, D or space

(error where the above checksum is invalid)
ChangeSummary: Version 1 - The rule has been rolled over from the previous year

If 'Yes' then the rule is not triggered

If the learning aim started on or after 1 August 2024 (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate


 >= 2024-08-01) and the learner is 24 or over at the start of the aim (

LearningDelivery.LearnStartDate
